ai.summary: Cross Bucks Way is a demanding long-distance route in the UK, spanning about 104.8 km and classified as a hard hike. The route traverses rural countryside, farm tracks, woodlands, and exposed open terrain, demanding good fitness, navigation, and weather preparedness. Expect multi-day trekking with varied surfaces and potential remote sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain ranges from grassy fields and muddy footpaths to bridleways and rocky or compact tracks. You’ll encounter country lanes, hedgerows, occasional woodland sections, stiles, and frequent ascents and descents. Distances between services can be long, so plan for food, water, and navigation between rural points.
ai.safety_notes: UK weather is highly changeable; check forecasts and carry layered clothing. The route’s length increases fatigue risk—plan sensible pacing and regular breaks. Bring a reliable map and compass or GPS, and inform someone of your itinerary and timings. Phone signal can be intermittent in remote stretches; know when to turn back if conditions deteriorate and carry an emergency plan.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing (base layer, fleece, outer shell)
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone with offline maps and portable charger
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Water bottles or hydration bladder (2–3 liters total)
Lightweight emergency shelter or space blanket
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September) offers the best conditions in the UK, with longer daylight and milder weather. Exercise caution in winter or during periods of heavy rain and floods; always check forecasts before setting out.

seo.title: Cross Bucks Way: 104.8 km UK Hike | Hard-Distance Trail
seo.meta_description: Plan your adventure on Cross Bucks Way, a 104.8 km hard-distance hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear recommendations, and the best seasons to hike.
